result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 8th and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI 8th and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Lou Tong Saephanh was found guilty of OWI 8th, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Lou Tong Saephanh in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Lou Tong Saephanh in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions the Defendant as to an interpreter.  (A Mien Interpreter was scheduled to appear via phone). Atty Renc states her client is not requesting one.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs in part with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: OWI 8th:

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2 PAC is dismissed. Count 3 is dismissed and Read In.

ADA Cousins request 4 yrs In & 5 yrs ES w/conditions. 
Atty Renc request 3 yrs In & 3 yrs ES  and a 107 days credit.

BY THE COURT: *****OWI 8th**PRISON**
Prison at 5 yrs Incarceration, Eligible for substance abuse after 4 yrs. 107 days credit.
4 yrs Extended Supervision
Conditions of Extend Supervision:
$1,200 fine + costs = $2,527.00
$26.45 Blood Draw costs
36 months Revocation of license
36 months Ignition Interlock Device (IID)
Comply with any counseling or treatments as determined by any of the assessments.
Absolute Sobriety.

Defendant is remanded to the prison system.
**INTEREPRETER TO APPEAR VIA TELEPHONE IS LINDA LEW sp
letter from Atty Anne Renc dated 02/18/16 in re:  request for a Mien Interpreter (not hmong)
**spoke with Karen @ CAP Services on 2/4/16 who will check into an interpreter
letter from ADA C.C. dated 02/03/16 providing the State's Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine and State's Proposed Jury Instructions and a request for a Hmong Interpreter
in Limine filed by the State
filed by the State
filed by Atty Renc for the defendant
Jury trial - 12 person at 03-09-2016 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 02-01-2016 09:30 am

Defendant Lou Tong Saephanh in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Lou Tong Saephanh in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:36 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Court has a motion to modify terms of bond, filed by Defendant.

Atty Renc addresses the Court, filed a motion to amend bond to a signature bond, requests the Court to find Defendant appropriate for the pretrial program.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, objects to the motion for reasons stated on the record, Defendant is not suited for the program.

Atty Renc addresses the Court regarding the pretrial home detention program, requests the Court to just find Defendant appropriate and then another hearing will be set.

Court addresses the parties. Defendant has been charged with an 8th OWI. Court is concerned about the State's indication that Defendant while under felony supervision in another state, absconded from that supervision and that Defendant has a significant history of similar offenses both in Wisconsin and in other states.

BY THE COURT:
Motion is denied. There is more than a reasonable basis exists that a significant cash bond is necessary for the Defendant's future court appearances.
and Defense Motion for Modification of Bond
by the State
by defendant
Pre-trial conference at 12-14-2015 09:30 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

3:13 p.m. Defendant Lou Tong Saephanh in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Lou Tong Saephanh in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA calls witness, Officer Prinse, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam. 3:15 p.m. cross exam by Atty Renc.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Atty Renc
Preliminary hearing at 12-07-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Lou Tong Saephanh appeared by video. Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of OWI - 8th offense.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $10,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  11/30/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
